subject: Productivity
title: Goal Neglect and Overload
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Goal Neglect and Overload.

hook.text: A person with one goal is focused. A person with twenty goals has a wish list.

buildup.text: Working memory holds about four items at once. More goals than that, and the brain starts dropping them.

discovery.text: Psychologists call this goal neglect. Too many active goals means none of them get enough attention.

twist.text: Warren Buffett's supposed advice: list 25 goals, circle the top five, avoid the other 20 at all costs.

climax.text: The most productive people don't set more goals. They ruthlessly cut the ones that don't matter.

punchline.text: More goals means less focus. Less focus means less progress.

quiz.question: What is goal neglect?
options: Having too many goals so none get enough attention
Not setting any goals at all
Setting goals that are too easy
